<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><rss xmlns:a10="http://www.w3.org/2005/Atom" version="2.0"><channel xml:base="http://www.vancouversun.com/"><title><![CDATA[Vancouver Sun - News / Vancouver]]></title><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/vancouver/index.html</link><description>CFL all-time leading receiver Geroy Simon says he doesn't "hold any animosity" towards the B.C. Lions, after the team traded him last year. The Lions announced Friday they will honour Simon's No. 81 at B.C. Place in July.</description><language>en-ca</language><copyright>Copyright (c) The Vancouver Sun</copyright><lastBuildDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 03:21:13 Z</lastBuildDate><category>Vancouver</category><category>Vancouver Sun</category><category>LIST</category><category>VASN</category><category>VASX</category><category>Y</category><category>UTF8</category><category>1</category><category relevance="100">6467183</category><category relevance="100">InformTagsOnly</category><category relevance="100">posted</category><category relevance="100">All</category><category relevance="100">news</category><category relevance="100">News</category><category relevance="100">News-Crime</category><category relevance="100">news/Vancouver/story.html</category><category relevance="100">Surrey-White Rock</category><category relevance="100">Vancouver</category><generator>(c) Postmedia Network Inc.</generator><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829644</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/richmond+names+schools+considered+closure/11829644/story.html</link><title>Richmond names 16 schools to be considered for closure</title><description>The Richmond school district has named 16 elementary schools that will be considered for closure.&#160; The district is faced with closing four or five schools due to declining enrolment and the need for seismic upgrades.&#160; Similar tough decisions are facing many B.C. school districts &#8212; Vancouver is looking at closing as many as 21 schools [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2016 20:02:01 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829645.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Richmond names 16 schools to be considered for closure" href="http://vancouversun.com/news/local-news/richmond-names-16-schools-to-be-considered-for-closure" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828954</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/affordability/home+sales+record+march+vancouver+area/11828954/story.html</link><title>Home sales hit record 5,000 in March in Vancouver area</title><description>For the first time in the Vancouver area, more than 5,000 homes have sold in a single month. A total of 5,173 residential properties were sold in the region in March, marking a 27.4-per-cent increase over March 2015 and a 24-per-cent increase over February 2016, according to the Real Estate Board of Greater Vancouver. &#8220;March [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Thu, 07 Apr 2016 14:41:59 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11804487.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Home sales hit record 5,000 in March in Vancouver area" href="http://vancouversun.com/business/real-estate/home-sales-hit-record-5000-in-march-in-vancouver-area" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829780</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/surrey+teen+killed+tragic+accident+sunshine+coast/11829780/story.html</link><title>Surrey teen killed in tragic ATV accident on Sunshine Coast</title><description>Friends and family mourned the death of a Surrey teen killed on the weekend in a single-vehicle ATV crash in Roberts Creek.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 04:43:00 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829781.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829511</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/judge+orders+edit+documentary+criticizing+vancouver/11829511/story.html</link><title>Judge orders edit of documentary criticizing Vancouver Aquarium</title><description>Vancouver &#160;&#8212; A B.C. Supreme Court judge has ordered a filmmaker to remove about five minutes of video from a documentary that criticizes the Vancouver Aquarium. Judge Jeanne Watchuk granted the aquarium an injunction and has instructed Gary Charbonneau to remove 15 video segments from the hour-long film within seven days. The aquarium is suing [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 00:45:37 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829512.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829407</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/crime/smartphone+surveillance+sting+against+accused+drug+smugglers/11829407/story.html</link><title>Smartphone surveillance led to sting against accused drug smugglers</title><description>Mail exchanges and surveillance show that two B.C. men acted as a broker and a courier for an international drug-smuggling ring, the Crown alleges. The trial for Matthew James Higgins and Hernan Osvaldo Veloso began on Monday in B.C. Supreme Court in New Westminster. Higgins is charged with one count of conspiring to traffic ecstasy [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 00:02:59 Z</pubDate><enclosure care should be part of basic health care: UBC study</title><description>All Canadians, especially low-income Canadians, should have dental care as part of their basic health care, a new study by the University of B.C. concludes.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 03:08:47 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829779.jpg" Day cocaine importer gets five years in jail</title><description>A U.S. citizen convicted of importing cocaine into Canada on Christmas Day 2014 will be spending several Christmases in a Canadian jail.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 02:38:46 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829693.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid failed to pay former B.C. agent for risky work, lawsuit claims</title><description>A man who claims to be a former agent for the RCMP is suing the force for allegedly failing to pay him for his clandestine activities. The man, identified in a lawsuit only as Agent E, &#160;says that from 20o1 until late 2014, he worked under the RCMP to provide investigative services in the areas [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 00:45:09 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829480.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829692</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/crime/body+found+burnaby+trail+after+reports+shots+fired/11829692/story.html</link><title>Body found on Burnaby trail after reports of shots fired</title><description>A man's body has been found on a Burnaby trail Monday.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2016 19:05:14 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829693.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Body found on Burnaby trail after reports of shots fired" href="http://vancouversun.com/news/crime/body-found-on-burnaby-trail" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827759</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/crime/another+shooting+surrey+pushes+total+this+year/11827759/story.html</link><title>Another shooting in Surrey pushes total to 30 this year</title><description>Shots rang out once again in Surrey Sunday, less than a day after a shooting near an elementary school. Surrey RCMP said it received several calls about a shooting between two vehicles at the intersection of 88th Avenue and 132 Street at around 5:45 p.m.&#160; An SUV and a car were&#160;stopped on a red light [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 06:43:19 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827229.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829333</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/crime/defence+witness+describes+lovebirds+beckett+murder+trial/11829333/story.html</link><title>Defence witness describes 'lovebirds' at Beckett murder trial</title><description>The final defence witness for a former New Zealand politician accused of drowning his Canadian wife while on a B.C. vacation in 2010 described the couple on Monday as &#8220;lovebirds&#8221; and the alleged victim as a troubled woman hesitant to accept help. Peter Beckett&#8217;s B.C. Supreme Court trial, which started in mid-January, is coming to [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 22:43:48 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829334.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829472</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/westjet+faces+potential+class+action+lawsuit+over/11829472/story.html</link><title>WestJet faces potential class-action lawsuit over alleged workplace harassment</title><description>A former WestJet flight attendant has launched a second lawsuit against the airline, alleging it doesn&#8217;t provide a harassment-free workplace for its female employees. Mandalena Lewis filed documents in British Columbia Supreme Court today, asking that the case be granted class-action status on behalf of all WestJet female flight attendants. Lewis originally launched a lawsuit [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 00:45:06 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829473.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829531</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/2c000+litres+diesel+fuel+spill+into+river+after/11829531/story.html</link><title>20,000 litres of diesel fuel spill into B.C. river after transport truck crash</title><description>PRINCETON &#8212; British Columbia&#8217;s Environment Ministry says about 20,000 litres of diesel fuel from a transport truck have spilled into the Similkameen River south of Princeton. The truck was involved in a motor vehicle incident on Highway 3 at about 8 a.m. Monday, and a ministry employee is at the site. The ministry says the [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 23:54:44 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829532.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829563</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/crime/guilty+pleas+surrey+assaults+case/11829563/story.html</link><title>Guilty pleas in Surrey sex-assaults case</title><description>A man charged in connection with a series of sexual and physical assaults on women that took place in Surrey has entered guilty pleas.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 23:59:12 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829564.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829548</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/crime/crown+urges+year+sentence+drug+fuelled+fatal+stabbing+burnaby/11829548/story.html</link><title>Crown urges 12.5-year sentence for drug-fuelled fatal stabbing</title><description>A B.C. Supreme Court jury found Trudy Gail Hunter, 62, guilty of the November 2013 second-degree murder of Christine Docherty, 61.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 00:45:58 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829480.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11829616</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/business/local+business/upngo+workplace+activity+program+launched+before/11829616/story.html</link><title>UPnGO workplace activity program launched in B.C. before nation-wide rollout</title><description>Vancouver &#8212; A program to get workers up and moving while on the job has rolled out in British Columbia, and it will be stretching the legs of employees across Canada by the fall. UPnGO with ParticipACTION was launched Monday by federal Health Minister Jane Philpott, B.C.&#8217;s Minister of Health Terry Lake and Elio Antunes, [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2016 01:06:43 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11829617.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid man's underwear gag for his wife leads to modelling gig</title><description>Brendon Williams freely admits his paunchy belly and bushy-black chest don't qualify him as typical chiselled male-model Vancouver breakthrough group Dear Rouge talks Juno Awards glory</title><description>Vancouver dance-rock duo Dear Rouge was named the Breakthrough Group of the Year this past weekend at the Juno isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11828704</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/canada/snowbirds+begin+preparations+this+week+comox+2016+show/11828704/story.html</link><title>Snowbirds to begin preparations this week in Comox for 2016 air show season</title><description>The Canadian military&#8217;s Snowbirds and CF-18 Demonstration Team will soon arrive in Comox to prepare for the 2016 air show season. The Snowbirds arrive on Thursday, April 6th, and the Demonstration CF-18 will arrive on Thursday, April 12th, according to local media.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 14:57:27 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11828706.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="Snowbirds to begin preparations this week in Comox for 2016 air show season" href="http://ottawacitizen.com/news/national/defence-watch/snowbirds-to-begin-preparations-this-week-in-comox-for-2016-air-show-season" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827196</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/parents+decry+devastating+planned+vancouver+school+board/11827196/story.html</link><title>Parents decry 'devastating' planned Vancouver School Board cuts</title><description>Parents are concerned about the Vancouver School Board's budget proposal, saying they're worried about larger class sizes, supports for special needs students and cuts to fine arts like music.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 13:54:22 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827197.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11826213</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/life/cream+lovers+makers+despair+over+vanilla+bean+price+hike/11826213/story.html</link><title>B.C.'s ice cream lovers and makers despair over vanilla bean price hike</title><description>A&#160;global vanilla crisis has turned B.C.&#8217;s tastemakers&#160;into&#160;a bunch of bean counters. Vanilla beans,&#160;the withered wonders behind&#160;the staple flavouring found in kitchens worldwide, are a labour-intensive crop requiring hand&#160;pollination, precise harvesting and&#160;a lengthy curing process.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2016 16:08:04 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11826215.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /><a10:link rel="external" type="text/html" title="B.C.'s ice cream lovers and makers despair over vanilla bean price hike" href="http://vancouversun.com/news/local-news/ice-cream-lovers-and-makers-despair-over-vanilla-bean-price-hike" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827311</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/syrian+refugees+their+first+taste+snow/11827311/story.html</link><title>Syrian refugees to B.C. get their first taste of snow</title><description>Refugee Ali Nabeel calls himself half Iraqi and half Syrian, and on Sunday he was a full-on dude on a snowboard. Nabeel, 16,who lives in Coquitlam, has been in Canada for nearly two years and was high on Mt. Seymour with 350 other refugees to try his luck on the sunny, snow-covered slopes in North [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 01:43:12 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827315.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11824757</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/entertainment/books/story+rape+resistance+healing/11824757/story.html</link><title>A story of rape, resistance and healing</title><description>It was the first hot day of spring, April 26, 1981. Two girls, giggling, talking about boys, shared a purloined cigarette on a wooded trail near their school in the University of B.C. endowment lands. Behind them a&#160;twig snapped. Then, the&#160;voice. &#8220;Put your hands on your head, turn around, and don&#8217;t look back.&#8221;</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 15:24:18 Z</pubDate><enclosure founder Peter Brown's Point Grey mansion sells for $31.1 million</title><description>A Point Grey home on Belmont Ave. owned by Peter Brown, the founder of investment dealer Canaccord Genuity Group, converge on Vancouver for cutting-edge grocery exhibition</title><description>A Vancouver-based natural soda, kimchee Brussels sprouts, ajvar from Macedonia&#160;&#8212; these are some of the latest the annual Grocery Specialty Food West, Western Canada&#8217;s only [&#8230;]</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 05:25:27 Z</pubDate><enclosure etiquette</title><description>When you&#8217;re out on the road with more than 50.000 other runners, bad habits like spitting or urinating in the bush just don't isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827427</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/redesigned+vancouver+unveiled/11827427/story.html</link><title>Redesigned Vancouver Sun to be unveiled</title><description>Starting Tuesday, we&#8217;ll be unveiling a number of changes to The Vancouver Sun in print, and digitally on web, smartphone and tablet. These changes reflect local audience research &#8212; and shifting trends across the media landscape &#8212; that tell us what readers are reading and how they connect with us through the day.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 02:44:03 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827428.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11826993</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/kelowna+tech+firm+guards+virtual+worlds+from/11826993/story.html</link><title>Kelowna tech firm guards virtual worlds from cyberbullies</title><description>As online communities come under the attack of cyberbullies, racist speech and spam, a British Columbia tech firm has developed technology to keep the trolls under the bridge.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2016 00:01:48 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827075.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827317</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/translink+moving+fully+closed+gates+starting+monday/11827317/story.html</link><title>TransLink moving to fully closed gates starting Monday</title><description>Gates will begin to close Monday at Lower Mainland transit stations, in what TransLink called a "major step" in the Compass system's roll-out.
Monday morning, all fare gates at SeaBus terminals and certain SkyTrain stations will be closed, requiring all riders to use a Compass card to tap in and enter.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 23:45:47 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827318.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11827220</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/seniors+care+facility+cuts+entire+staff+over+reports/11827220/story.html</link><title>B.C. seniors-care facility cuts entire staff over reports of chronic underfunding</title><description>A seniors-care home in Nanaimo is laying off its entire staff thanks to years of chronic underfunding by the region's health authority.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 22:43:35 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827221.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11826668</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/sports/soccer/vancouver+whitecaps+survive+cards+scoreless+draw+against/11826668/story.html</link><title>Whitecaps survive red tide in scoreless draw against Galaxy</title><description>MLS is quickly becoming the Oprah Winfrey of soccer leagues.
&#8220;You get a red card, and you get a red card. Everybody gets a red card!&#8221;</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 15:50:07 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11826631.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid isPermaLink="false">tag:www.vancouversun.com:content=11826453</guid><link>http://www.vancouversun.com/news/local+news/warns+students+after+attempts+break+into+residence/11826453/story.html</link><title>UBC warns students after man attempts to break into residence lounge</title><description>The University of British Columbia has sent a warning email to students who live on campus after a man attempted to break in to a residence lounge where a female resident was studying.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 15:25:09 Z</pubDate><enclosure Good People poignant but imperfect</title><description>Now running at the Arts Club&#8217;s Stanley Industrial Alliance Stage, Good People by American playwright David Lindsay-Abaire is a dark comedy about a clash between two such people in Boston &#8212; downtrodden Margaret, played by Colleen Wheeler, and successful Mike, performed by Scott Bellis.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 Apr 2016 22:43:15 Z</pubDate><enclosure url="http://www.vancouversun.com/cms/binary/11827200.jpg" type="image/jpeg" /></item><item><guid shooting leaves man in serious condition</title><description>A man is in serious condition after a reported shooting in Surrey Saturday night.</description><source>Vancouver</source><pubDate>Sun, 03 city, park officials mourn death of arborist</title><description>Vancouver City Hall has launched an investigation into the tragic death of long-term arborist Jody Taylor, who was crushed by a branch
